intro: Scabiosa arvensis var. integrifolia, commonly known as the field scabious, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, pink or white flowers. The leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a smooth, entire margin, which distinguishes it from other varieties. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in meadows and along roadsides. The plant is also known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
